item.title: 德国警方开展与北方数据有关的突袭行动
item.description: 法兰克福检察官周五表示，德国警方对数据中心公司 Northern Data AG 进行了突击检查。【原文：German police carried out raids related to data center company Northern Data AG, Frankfurt-based prosecutors said on Friday.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴尔金称就业和通胀面临的风险有限
item.description: 里士满联邦储备银行行长汤姆-巴金（Tom Barkin）表示，虽然失业率和通胀率都偏离了美国中央银行的目标，但他认为这两方面进一步恶化的风险有限。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond President Tom Barkin said while unemployment and inflation have both moved away from the US central bank’s goals, he sees only limited risk of further deterioration on both fronts.】

item.title: GA Credit 旗舰基金完成 21 亿美元首笔交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，通用大西洋信贷公司（General Atlantic Credit）为其最新的机会主义信贷基金完成了 21 亿美元的首笔交易，这是一个最新迹象，表明长期的高利率环境正促使企业寻求更具创造性的融资方式。【原文：General Atlantic Credit has hit a $2.1 billion first close for its latest opportunistic credit fund, according to people with knowledge of the matter, in the latest sign that the prolonged higher-rate environment is pushing companies to seek more creative ways to raise capital.】

item.title: 丹-艾夫斯和汤姆-李用社交媒体传声筒绕过华尔街
item.description: 战胜市场很难，最近赢得新资金更难。然而，就在许多选股人眼睁睁地看着自己的客户离场时，两位华尔街大牛却在社交媒体上大放异彩。【原文：Beating the market is hard, and lately, winning new money even harder. Yet two Wall Street bulls with social-media megaphones are doing both, just as many stock pickers are watching their clients walk away.】

item.title: 莫迪宣布在印度投票日所在邦投入 8.45 亿美元
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）在地方选举前宣布向印度贫困的比哈尔邦妇女发放超过 8.45 亿美元的现金。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced cash handouts of more than $845 million to women in the impoverished Indian state of Bihar before local elections, which are seen as a crucial test of his popularity as he looks to consolidate power.】

item.title: 英国石油公司的石油需求峰值转变捕捉到了行业的时代精神
item.description:
曾经看似迅速脱离粗制滥造，现在看来更像是一种拖沓的高原反应。【原文：

What once looked like a rapid pivot away from crude now appears more like a drawn-out plateau.

】

item.title: 欧盟对从俄罗斯进口的化肥展开反倾销调查
item.description: 在欧盟化肥生产商抱怨从俄罗斯进口的尿素压低了市场价格之后，欧盟对进口尿素展开了调查。【原文：The European Union opened an investigation into urea imports from Russia after fertilizer producers in the bloc complained the shipments undercut market prices.】

item.title: 美国签证政策的不确定性促使科技人才向新的中心转移
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，Sankalp Phartiyal 将探讨美国移民管制对美国大型科技巨头员工情绪的影响。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Sankalp Phartiyal addresses the impact of US immigration controls on the mood among workers powering the country’s big tech juggernauts.】

item.title: 蕾切尔-里夫斯的英国预算是多年来最艰难的预算之一
item.description: 我是乔-梅耶斯，驻伦敦的英国政府记者。今天我们将关注英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）面临的预算挑战。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您尚未注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击此处。【原文：I’m Joe Mayes, a UK government reporter in London. Today we’re looking at the budget challenges faced by Chancellor Rachel Reeves. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 三色公司新贷款服务团队被锁在大楼外
item.description: 在三色控股公司（Tricolor Holdings）光滑的玻璃石总部内，随处可见突然陷入破产的汽车贷款巨头的残骸。在四楼办公室的一角，堆放着几十个车牌。在另一个角落里，则堆满了汽车所有权证。现在员工都走了，公司倒闭时被集体解雇，贷款回收系统也瘫痪了。【原文：Inside the sleek glass-and-stone headquarters of Tricolor Holdings, the remains of an auto-lending juggernaut plunged suddenly into bankruptcy were visible everywhere. In one corner of the fourth floor office, there were scores of license plates, piled high. In another, there were stacks of car titles. The employees were all gone now, fired en masse when the firm went under, and the loan-collection system was down.】

item.title: 关于美国与中国的 TikTok 协议，我们知道和不知道的事情
item.description: 经过一年多的谈判，中美两国即将达成协议，将社交媒体平台 TikTok 的美国业务剥离给一个财团，该财团可能包括软件巨头甲骨文公司。如果该协议最终敲定，将解决北京与华盛顿关系中的一个老大难问题，该问题已与更广泛的贸易谈判纠缠在一起。【原文：After more than a year of negotiations, the US and China are nearing an agreement to hive off the US operations of social media platform TikTok to a consortium that could include software giant Oracle Corp. If the deal is finalized, it would resolve a persistent issue in Beijing-Washington relations that has become entangled in broader talks over trade.】

item.title: 尽管有贸易战，外国人抢购美股的速度仍创纪录
item.description:
虽然S&P 500指数的回报率一直很稳健，但其他方面的回报率可能会更高。【原文：

While S&P 500 returns have been solid, returns might have been stronger elsewhere.

】

item.title: 挪威财富基金将向布鲁克菲尔德基金投资 15 亿美元
item.description: 挪威 2 万亿美元的主权财富基金将投资于布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）管理的能源转型基金，以扩大其非上市可再生能源资产的投资组合。【原文：Norway’s $2 trillion sovereign wealth fund will invest in an energy transition fund managed by Brookfield Asset Management, as it seeks to broaden its portfolio of unlisted renewable assets.】

item.title: 埃尼、埃克森等公司因操纵燃油价格在意大利被罚
item.description: 埃尼公司（Eni SpA）和埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp.【原文：Eni SpA and a unit of Exxon Mobil Corp. are among refiners and fuel distributors in Italy that were fined about $1 billion for allegedly fixing prices, which at least two of the companies denied.】

item.title: 中国扩大在岸回购渠道，推动人民币资产增长
item.description: 中国正在扩大债券回购市场准入，此举可能会鼓励全球投资者购买人民币资产。【原文：China is expanding access to its bond repurchase market, a move that may encourage global investors to buy yuan-denominated assets.】

item.title: 贝森特为阿根廷提供 200 亿美元支持，使美国资金面临风险
item.description: 特朗普政府为阿根廷提供的 200 亿美元救命钱依赖于财政部的一项基金，该基金过去曾被成功用于救助陷入困境的盟国--但它仍可能给美国纳税人带来风险。【原文：The Trump administration’s $20 billion lifeline for Argentina leans on a Treasury fund that’s been successfully used to bail out troubled allies in the past – but it could still carry risks for US taxpayers.】

item.title: 尼日利亚批准道达尔能源公司价值 5.1 亿美元的邦加股权出售计划
item.description: 尼日利亚批准道达尔能源 SE 将其在包括邦加油田在内的一个区块的股份出售给壳牌石油公司和尼日利亚 Agip 勘探公司，这标志着这家法国大型企业的资产重组和还债战略取得了进展。【原文：Nigeria approved TotalEnergies SE’s sale of its stake in a block that includes the Bonga field to Shell Plc and Nigerian Agip Exploration, marking progress in the French major’s strategy to restructure assets and pay down debt.】

item.title: 中国收紧电动汽车出口规定，2026 年起必须获得许可
item.description: 从明年起，中国的汽车制造商出口电动汽车将需要许可证，这进一步表明中国政府正在加强对全球最大汽车市场的管理。【原文：China’s automakers will need permits to export electric vehicles from next year, adding to signs officials are tightening their management of the world’s biggest car market.】

item.title: Meta 将在英国推出付费版 Facebook 和 Instagram
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. 不久将在英国提供付费版 Facebook 和 Instagram，这两个平台将取消广告。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. will soon offer paid versions of Facebook and Instagram in the UK that will remove advertising from both platforms.】

item.title: 经济学家下调美国到 2026 年的就业增长，助推降息
item.description: 经济学家们下调了对明年年底前美国就业增长的预测，这有助于解释为什么美联储预计将继续降低利率。【原文：Economists downgraded their projections for US job growth through the end of next year, helping explain why the Federal Reserve is expected continue to lower interest rates.】

item.title: 法国农民用拖拉机抗议欧盟与南方共同市场的贸易协定
item.description: 农民们在法国各地举行抗议活动，敦促政府阻止欧盟与南美国家的自由贸易协定，保护他们免受他们所说的不公平竞争。【原文：Farmers staged protests across France, urging the government to block a European Union free-trade deal with South American nations and protect them from what they say will be unfair competition.】

item.title: 游说团体称，新规实施后全球银行可能在欧盟增加 1000 个工作岗位
item.description: 由于新规定将于 2027 年生效，预计全球银行将为其在欧盟的业务增加或转移多达 1000 名员工。【原文：Global banks are expected to add or move as many as 1,000 employees to their operations in the European Union because of new rules that will take effect in 2027.】

item.title: 美国承诺向莫桑比克提供 1.6 亿美元的艾滋病和结核病援助
item.description: 美国承诺为莫桑比克提供 1.6 亿美元的临时援助，用于艾滋病毒和结核病的检测和治疗，而此前数月的不确定性是由于 1 月份的外援审查导致美国国际开发署关闭而引发的。【原文：The US pledged $160 million in interim assistance for HIV and tuberculosis testing and treatment in Mozambique, after months of uncertainty triggered by a foreign aid review in January that led to the closure of the US Agency for International Development.】

item.title: 特朗普医药关税计划看似许多制药商的缓兵之计
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划对进口品牌药和专利药征收 100%的关税，许多投资者对这一计划无动于衷。【原文：President Donald Trump’s plan to impose a 100% tariff on branded and patented drug imports was greeted with a shrug by many investors, who are betting his exemptions for companies with US manufacturing will soften any blow.】

item.title: 尽管有贸易战，外国人购买美股的速度仍创纪录
item.description: 去年春天，唐纳德-特朗普发动了贸易战，妄想吞并加拿大，并普遍扰乱了全球对美国的情绪，外国买家抵制美国金融产品的担忧日益加剧。【原文：As Donald Trump unleashed his trade war, mused about annexing Canada and generally roiled global sentiment toward the US last spring, worries mounted that foreign buyers would boycott American financial products.】

item.title: 印度最大的植物油买家认为更便宜的豆油推动了棕榈油的转移
item.description: 印度是世界上最大的植物油买家，据一位顶级进口商称，明年印度将增加豆油的采购量，因为全球大豆作物的丰收使得豆油的价格比竞争对手棕榈油便宜。【原文：India, the world’s biggest vegetable oil buyer, is poised to boost soybean oil purchases next year as bumper global crops have made the commodity cheaper than rival palm, according to a top importer.】

item.title: 中国人工智能电路制造商摩尔芯线上海上市获绿灯
item.description: 摩尔线程技术有限公司（Moore Threads Technology Co.【原文：Moore Threads Technology Co., which makes equipment used in areas like artificial intelligence and machine learning, received approval from the Shanghai Stock Exchange for its initial public offering on the Star Market.】

item.title: 任天堂任命二十年资深人士掌管美国业务
item.description: 任天堂公司（Nintendo Co., Ltd.）任命了一位新的领导人，从明年起负责美国业务，提升了一位在业界工作了 19 年的资深人士，以监督 Switch 2 在其最大市场的进展情况。【原文：Nintendo Co. has appointed a new leader for its US operations starting next year, elevating a 19-year industry veteran to oversee the Switch 2’s progress in its largest market.】

item.title: 斯洛伐克在《宪法》中对两性做出定义，人权问题备受关注
item.description: 斯洛伐克修订了宪法，只承认男女两性，并将国家主权（尤其是在文化和伦理问题上）置于国际人权条约之上。【原文：Slovakia amended its constitution to recognize only two sexes and prioritize national sovereignty, particularly in cultural and ethical matters, over international human rights treaties.】

item.title: 国际文传电讯社报道：俄罗斯计划继续加大国防开支
item.description: 俄罗斯打算在未来三年内将军费开支维持在较高水平，这削弱了克里姆林宫准备尽快结束乌克兰战争的想法。【原文：Russia intends to keep military expenditures at a high level over the next three years, undermining notions the Kremlin is preparing to end its war on Ukraine any time soon.】
